abstract: On Friday morning, 19 percent of the electricity on Texas’s grid was supplied by turbines — the second record in a week. But transmission problems loom.
snippet: On Friday morning, 19 percent of the electricity on Texas’s grid was supplied by turbines — the second record in a week. But transmission problems loom.
lead_paragraph: Texas, the nation’s wind-power leader, set a new record for wind generation this morning, when — at 6:37 a.m. — about 19 percent of the electricity on the state’s main grid was supplied by turbines.

headline.main: Setting Wind Power Records in Texas
